ko: 우리 선생님은 다음 달에 미국에 가실 거야.

en: Our teacher lives at the extreme end of the street.
ko: 우리 선생님은 이 길 맨 끝에 사셔.

en: Our teacher favors only the girl students.
Our teacher is marking papers.
Our teacher speaks French as well as English.
Our teacher doesn't just speak English, but French too.
ko: 우리 선생님은 영어뿐만 아니라 프랑스어도 하셔.

en: Our teacher seldom laughs.
Our teacher is patient with us even when we ask silly questions.
ko: 우리 선생님은 우리가 바보 같은 질문을 해도 잘 참아주셔.

en: Our teacher will return from abroad in August.
Our teachers say ours is the best school in the state, and in a way, it is.
ko: 선생님들은 우리 학교가 이 지역에서 최고라고 하시는데, 어떤 면에선 정말 그래.

en: Our task has been easy so far, but it will be difficult from now on.
Our mode of life has changed since the introduction of European civilization.
ko: 유럽 문명이 도입된 이후로 우리 생활 방식이 바뀌었어.

en: We owed our success to their help.
ko: 우리가 성공한 건 그분들의 도움 덕분이었어.

en: Our library is on the third floor.
Our train went through a long tunnel.
Our train was delayed on account of the heavy snow.
How about staying with us for a few days?
ko: 며칠 동안 우리랑 같이 지내는 건 어때?

en: It's time to leave.
Our car broke down in the middle of the street.
ko: 우리 차가 길 한복판에서 고장 났어.

en: Our car ran out of gas after two minutes.
ko: 우리 차가 2분 만에 기름이 다 떨어졌어.

en: Don't worry about us.
All our attempts failed.
We have a 20% share of the market.
Our city is rather small in comparison with Tokyo.
ko: 도쿄에 비하면 우리 도시는 꽤 작은 편이야.

en: We have a local newspaper in our city.
Our work is all over now.
Our country produces a lot of sugar.
Our thinking is flexible.
You shall listen to us.
ko: 넌 우리 말을 들어야 할 거야.

en: Our plan was objected to by the majority.
Whatever we decide must be approved by the committee.
ko: 우리가 무엇을 결정하든 위원회의 승인을 받아야 해.

en: Whatever we may decide must be approved by the committee.
ko: 우리가 무엇을 결정하든지 위원회의 승인을 받아야 해.

en: Our plans went wrong.
All our plans went wrong.
The air we breathe consists of oxygen and nitrogen.
ko: 우리가 마시는 공기는 산소와 질소로 이루어져 있어요.

en: Our holiday plans are still up in the air.
ko: 우리 휴가 계획은 아직 결정된 게 없어요.

en: Our basic problem is the lack of know-how.
ko: 우리 근본적인 문제는 노하우가 부족하다는 거예요.

en: I hope to see our relationship expand.
Our school burned down.
ko: 우리 학교가 불에 타서 다 타버렸어요.

en: Our school is in the south of the city.
Our school is situated on a hill.
Our school is near the station.
Our school was established in 1951.
There are 30 classes in our school.
ko: 우리 학교에는 학급이 서른 개 있어요.

en: It has already been sixty years since our school was founded.
ko: 우리 학교가 세워진 지 벌써 60년이나 됐어요.

en: Our town was bombed twice this week.
ko: 이번 주에 우리 마을에 폭격이 두 번이나 있었어요.

en: No other woman in our company is so proud as she.
ko: 우리 회사에서 그 여자만큼 자부심이 강한 사람도 없어요.

en: In the course of our conversation, he referred to his youth.
ko: 대화하다 보니 그 사람이 자기 어릴 때 이야기를 하더라고요.

en: Our house has seven rooms including the dining room.
ko: 우리 집은 식당을 포함해서 방이 일곱 개예요.

en: The previous owners of our house moved to Liverpool.
ko: 우리 집 예전 주인은 리버풀로 이사 갔어요.

en: Our house was broken into by burglars last night.
Some of us went by bus, and the others by bicycle.
ko: 우리 중 몇 명은 버스로 갔고 나머지는 자전거로 갔어요.

en: Our hotel faces the coast.
ko: 우리 호텔은 해안가를 마주 보고 있어요.

en: Our team triumphed over theirs.
Our football team has a good defense.
Our team did very well.
Not all of us are against his idea.
ko: 우리 모두가 그 사람 생각에 반대하는 건 아니에요.

en: Our soccer game will be postponed.
Our class will go on a picnic next week.
ko: 우리 반은 다음 주에 소풍 가요.

en: Our class is a small one.
Our class consists of thirty students.
ko: 우리 반은 서른 명으로 구성되어 있어요.

en: None of us could arrive at the harbor on time.
ko: 우리 중 아무도 제시간에 항구에 도착하지 못했어요.

en: None of us have succeeded.
ko: 우리 중 성공한 사람이 아무도 없어요.

en: Don't forget to write to us.
ko: 우리한테 편지 쓰는 거 잊지 마세요.

en: I asked the waiter to see about getting us a better table.
ko: 웨이터한테 더 좋은 자리로 줄 수 있는지 물어봤어요.

en: We have two daughters.
We were greatly amused by her story.
ko: 그 여자 이야기 듣고 정말 즐거웠어요.

en: We have many friends to visit in Tokyo.
We need fresh air.
We have a lot of homework to do.
We had a pleasant evening.
We have everything we need: money, time, and brains.
ko: 돈, 시간, 머리까지 필요한 건 다 갖췄어요.

en: We have the ability to memorize information.
Give us two knives and four forks, please.
ko: 나이프 두 개랑 포크 네 개 주세요.

en: It makes a difference to us whether it rains tomorrow.
ko: 내일 비가 올지 안 올지는 저희한테 중요해요.

en: It's great fun for us to be with her.
ko: 그 여자랑 같이 있으면 정말 재밌어요.

en: Let's ask some questions.
Won't you join us for dinner?
Would you like to play soccer with us?
Would you like to eat with us?
Beth looked after our dog while we were away.
ko: 우리가 없는 동안 베스가 우리 강아지를 돌봐줬어요.

en: It is a good idea for us to play shogi after dinner.
ko: 저녁 먹고 장기 두는 거 좋은 생각 같아요.

en: There is enough room for us to play.
There was nothing that we could do for them.
ko: 그들을 위해 우리가 할 수 있는 게 아무것도 없었어요.

en: The hotel which I am staying at is near the station.
ko: 내가 묵고 있는 호텔은 역 근처예요.

en: The hotel I'm staying at is near the station.
The hotel at which we stayed was very comfortable.
It began to rain as we came near the pass.
ko: 고개 근처에 가니까 비가 오기 시작하더라고요.

en: They gave us a hearty welcome when we arrived.
ko: 도착했을 때 정말 따뜻하게 환영해 줬어요.

en: The higher we go up, the thinner the air becomes.
The English Channel was rough when we came across.
ko: 영국 해협 건널 때 바다가 진짜 거칠었어요.

en: The day when we arrived was a holiday.
The day we arrived was a holiday.
It was raining when we arrived.
To our great surprise, he suddenly resigned.
ko: 정말 놀랍게도 그 사람이 갑자기 사직했더라고요.

en: It was after dark when we got to the village.
ko: 마을에 도착했을 땐 이미 날이 어두워진 뒤였어요.

en: Your help is indispensable to our success.
ko: 우리의 성공을 위해 당신의 도움이 꼭 필요해요.

en: The bullet train we were on pulled out at 12 sharp.
Our bus left at eight, arriving in Boston at eleven.
Is there anyone we invited who hasn't come yet?
ko: 우리 초대한 사람 중에 아직 안 온 사람 있나요?

en: We'll start as soon as it stops raining.
In spite of our congratulations, he frowned and turned away.
In modern times we have gone through two world wars as the end result of international disputes.
ko: 현대에는 국제 분쟁의 결과로 두 번의 세계 대전을 겪었죠.

en: The best policy for us to observe is to mind our own business.
ko: 우리가 할 수 있는 최선은 그냥 남의 일에 신경 끄는 거예요.

en: The music we listened to last night was wonderful.
Do you remember the day when we first met?
There are not enough chairs for us to sit on.
The man whom we saw in the park was Mr Hill.
The man we saw in the park was Mr. Hill.

When we say that a language is culturally transmitted - that is, that it is learned rather than inherited - we mean that it is part of that whole complex of learned and shared behavior that anthropologists call culture.
ko: 언어가 문화적으로 전승된다는 건 유전되는 게 아니라 학습된다는 거고, 인류학자들이 말하는 '문화'라는 공유된 행동 양식의 일부라는 뜻이에요.

en: Three years have passed since we married.
Three years have gone by since we got married.
It's been three years since we got married.
When we went to the hall, the concert had already begun.
ko: 공연장에 갔을 때는 콘서트가 이미 시작한 뒤였어요.

en: By the time we reached home, the sun had completely set.
ko: 집에 도착했을 땐 해가 완전히 져 있었어요.

en: When we got to the station, the train had already left.
ko: 역에 도착했을 때 기차는 이미 떠나고 없었어요.

en: Even though we tried hard, we couldn't beat Jane.
ko: 노력은 많이 했는데 제인을 이길 수가 없었어요.

en: The field where we used to play ball is now all built up.
ko: 예전에 공놀이하던 벌판에 이제 건물이 꽉 들어찼어요.

en: We do not all go.
Do you remember the day when we first met Dick?
ko: 우리 딕을 처음 만난 날 기억해요?

en: Two hours is too short for us to discuss the matter.
ko: 이 문제를 논의하기에 두 시간은 너무 짧아요.

en: It is becoming important for us to know how to use a computer.
ko: 컴퓨터 사용법을 아는 게 점점 중요해지고 있어요.

en: We arrived here fast, didn't we?
When we went to karaoke, Tom went on singing all night.
ko: 노래방 갔을 때 톰은 밤새 노래만 불렀어요.

en: It is very important for us to know each other.
ko: 우리가 서로를 아는 건 아주 중요해요.

en: There is no telling when we will fall ill.
It is impossible for us to cross that river.
ko: 우리가 그 강을 건너는 건 불가능해요.

en: We have freed you from a great anxiety.
We're going to the movies. Are you game?
ko: 우리 영화 보러 갈 건데, 같이 갈래요?

en: I wish I had a room of my own.
Don't pry into my private life.
I have never been there myself.
ko: 저도 거기 직접 가본 적은 없어요.

en: I've never been there myself.
I myself have never seen a UFO.
As for me, instead of trying to be a cool, international man, I would like to be an open-minded earth person.
ko: 저는 멋진 국제적인 남자보다는 마음이 열린 지구인이 되고 싶어요.

en: I myself saw it.
I'll get my son to go instead of going myself.
ko: 제가 직접 가는 대신 아들을 보낼게요.

en: I myself did it.
Don't interfere in private concerns.
Methinks my own soul must be a bright invisible green.
ko: 제 영혼은 아마 보이지 않는 밝은 초록색일 거예요.

en: I have to part with my old furniture.
Get off my back about my personal life!
Let me give you my personal opinion.
In my personal opinion I am against the plan.
ko: 제 개인적인 생각으로는 그 계획에 반대해요.

en: For myself, I would like to take part in the game.
From my personal point of view, his opinion is right.
ko: 제 개인적인 견해로는 그 사람 의견이 맞아요.

en: Everybody is busy except me.
Everyone except me was invited.
Everyone except me knew it.
Everybody knows it except me.
Nobody has heard of it but me.
Are there any messages for me?
Is there any mail for me?
Don't deceive me.
The girl staring back at me was angry.
ko: 절 빤히 쳐다보던 그 여자는 화가 나 있었어요.

en: Don't let me down.
Don't let me become discouraged.
It is kind of him to invite me to dinner.
ko: 저녁 식사에 초대해 주시다니 그분은 참 친절하시네요.

en: It is very kind of you to invite me to dinner.
ko: 저녁 식사에 초대해 주셔서 정말 친절하시네요.

en: Will you take me to the gate?
Don't pass me over.
Tell him either to call on me or to ring me up.
ko: 저한테 들르든지 전화를 달라고 그 사람한테 전해 주세요.

en: Let me in, please.
Don't bar me out.
Don't leave me behind!
Don't wait dinner for me.
How nice of you to invite me along!
ko: 같이 가자고 초대해 주셔서 정말 고마워요!

en: Don't laugh at me.
I intend to decline his offer to help me.
ko: 도와주겠다는 그 사람 제안을 거절할 생각이에요.

en: I have no one to help me.
I have a lot of friends to help me.
Can you help me?
He took a risk when he helped me.
Let me step inside.
I'll be glad if you will help me.
I'd be happy if you'd help me.
I'd appreciate it if you'd help me.
How kind of you to help me!
It is kind of her to help me.
It is very kind of you to help me.
Please help me.
Please come to my room to help me.
It is kind of you to give me a ride.
It was his lengthy narrative that bored me to death.
ko: 그 사람 얘기가 너무 길어서 지루해 죽는 줄 알았어요.

en: It was the teacher's narrative that bored me to death.
ko: 선생님 얘기가 지루해서 죽는 줄 알았어.

en: I hope you will hear me out.
ko: 내 말 좀 끝까지 들어줬으면 좋겠어.

en: Don't treat me as if I were a child.
Let me go!
Allow me to go.
Stop bothering me!
As soon as she saw me, she greeted me with a smile.
ko: 그 여자는 나를 보자마자 웃으면서 인사했어.

en: Seeing me, the dog rushed up to me.
No sooner had he seen me than he began to run away.
Look at me.
Seeing me, the baby began to cry.
He looked at me and barked.
Seeing me, she was embarrassed.
Seeing me, the dog wagged its tail.
Please look at me.
What surprised me was his cold attitude.
ko: 나를 놀라게 한 건 그의 차가운 태도였어.

en: Don't make little of me.
Don't underestimate me.
You shouldn't underestimate me.
Later, the nurse told me she had done her best to make me well.
ko: 나중에 간호사분이 나를 낫게 하려고 최선을 다했다고 말해줬어.

en: It's kind of you to drive me home.
I think I can reach the branch if you'll give me a boost.
ko: 네가 나 좀 받쳐주면 나뭇가지에 손이 닿을 것 같아.

en: Please leave me alone. I am busy.
ko: 나 좀 내버려 둬. 나 바빠.

en: Could you introduce me to Mr Ono of Randolph, Ltd?
ko: 랜드로프 사의 오노 씨 좀 소개해 줄 수 있어?

en: You can call me Bob.
Do you think I'm an idiot?
It is no use trying to play a trick on me.
The ones who shout at me don't bother me.
ko: 나한테 소리 지르는 사람들 같은 건 신경 안 써.

en: It is no use trying to deceive me.
Deceive me once, and I will forgive you; deceive me twice, and you're a double-crosser.
ko: 한 번 속이면 용서해 주겠지만, 두 번 속이면 그땐 배신자야.

en: They had great fun at my expense.
ko: 걔네는 나를 골탕 먹이면서 아주 즐거워했어.

en: It is very kind of you to invite me to the party.
Don't apply that nickname to me.
Send me there.
Please call me Joe.
It seems like you know me, but I don't know you.
ko: 넌 나를 아는 것 같은데 난 널 모르겠어.

en: You seem to know me, but I don't know you.
ko: 너 나 아는 것 같아 보이는데 난 너 누군지 모르겠어.

en: Don't make sport of me.
Don't disappoint me.
I entreat your pardon.
Don't pick on me, please.
Would you introduce me to your friend, Mr Murphy?
ko: 네 친구 머피 씨 좀 소개해 줄래?

en: You can't bend me to your will.
ko: 네 마음대로 날 휘두를 순 없어.

en: Please show me around.
Do you take me for forty? You are wide of the mark.
ko: 내가 마흔 살로 보여? 한참 잘못 짚었어.

en: He is my senior by three years.
He's three years older than me.
He cannot be older than I.
ko: 그가 나보다 나이가 많을 리 없어.

en: He can't be older than I am.
ko: 걔가 나보다 나이가 많을 리가 없는데.

en: He can't be older than me.
ko: 걔가 나보다 나이가 많을 리가 없어.

en: Mother is more anxious about the result of the examination than I am.
ko: 나보다 엄마가 시험 결과를 더 걱정하세요.

en: I also stopped sleeping.
You and I are both students at this school.
ko: 우리 둘 다 이 학교 학생이에요.

en: I wish I could swim as far as he can.
ko: 저도 그 사람만큼 멀리 수영할 수 있으면 좋겠어요.

en: I do not like him either.
I will do it the same.
I am also a citizen of Tokyo.
I'd like to order the same.
I can ride a horse, too.
I am a teacher, too.
I, too, am a teacher.
I'm also a teacher.
Let me in under your umbrella.
I also went.
I went, too.
I'm fine too.
I am no more interested in physics than you are.
All of us, including me, rode the bus.
ko: 저를 포함해서 우리 모두 버스를 탔어요.

en: I love music, too.
I will also become a grown-up before long.
I like English, too.
I'm glad to meet you, too, Mr Ito.
I don't know what to do either.
I'm a councillor, too.
He added that I should come to the party, too.
ko: 그 사람이 저보고도 파티에 오라고 하더라고요.

en: I also had a very good time.
Nor can I.
I can't do it either.
So do I.
I was just thinking of the same thing. I'm all for that.
ko: 저도 마침 그 생각 하던 참이었어요. 전적으로 찬성이에요.

en: I also went there.
I've heard a lot about that, too.
I get off there, too.
I've been invited there, too.
Nor am I.
I think so, too.
I also think so.
I wish I could find one just like it.
ko: 저도 똑같은 걸 찾을 수 있으면 좋겠어요.

en: I don't, either.
Me too.
Same here.
I would not have known him.
I'm a stranger here myself. I'm afraid I can't help you.
ko: 저도 여기가 처음이라 잘 모르겠어요. 도움을 드릴 수가 없네요.

en: I'm a stranger here myself. I'm afraid that I can't help you.
ko: 저도 여기가 처음이라 잘 모르겠어요. 도움을 드릴 수가 없네요.

en: I myself did not know him.
I'm a stranger here myself.
This is also the first time I've been to this area.
Nice seeing you, too.
Please take me along with you.
I want to have a part-time job, too.
I'm glad to meet you, too.
I didn't know you were coming here either.
